Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2012 08:27PM invisible2 wrote: I am getting my second TC right now. My hair started falling out at day 14, On day 18 I buzzed it to 1/2". I am shedding like a Labrador so tonight the close buzz and shaved smooth. I can't stand cleaning up the hair. The first buzz was liberating so I suspect the second will feel the same. I am in control of when my hair is gone...BC has been driving for 6 months so it felt good to drive for a little bit. Life - I admire your willingness to show your new style. I did not buy a wig. I plan to use scarves and baseball hats! 2 down, 4 more to go :-)
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2012 teeballmom SusanHG123

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 08:55PM invisible2 wrote: Okay...day 14 my scalp started to tingle and itch.  After a few days of pretty rapid hair loss I asked my neighbor to buzz it for me.  The reality of the hair loss was much easier than the weeks I spent worrying and dreading it.  I have been a passenger on the BC bus for most of the last 6 months, rarely getting to drive.  I drove this week.  Now I just need to learn how to tie these stupid scarves.  I am having my second round on Tues 8/7.  I did really well after the first round.  I had minor SE, the worst of which was the lack of sleep due to the steroids.  I started practicing Yoga in the past couple of months as a way to gain movement back in my arms.  What I discovered is that Yoga helped my body and my mind.  I walk away from each session feeling 'lighter' and more at peace and it did help me gain more movement in my arms. I thank each and every one of you for sharing here.  Your posts are like bright lights in a very dark hallway. I wish you all minimal SE as we take this journey together.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2012 teeballmom SusanHG123

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 07:05PM - edited Aug 6, 2012 07:06PM by invisible2 Hey Melrose!  Big HOORAY for your last visit to the BGC for chemo.  You have been such a big help to those of us just starting.  You are giving us all such a positive outlook.  It's contagious.   Wishing you minimal SE.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2012 teeballmom SusanHG123

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2012 03:42PM invisible2 wrote: That's great news...I've been following your post and thought I would jump to say congratulations!

Posts.Content: May 3, 2012 09:01PM invisible2 wrote: I am scheduled for May 17th, BMX with reconstruction.  I am glad I have the date but really afraid at facing the life altering experience.  I have no idea what to expect or how to prepare so will be reading and watching for hints & help.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2012 12:17AM invisible2 wrote: I understand your feelings of frustration at how slow the pace is.  I was officially diagnosed on 2/27 (I really knew well before then) and still don't have a treatment plan.  I agree with bdavis - ask for an MRI.  The only doctor I have seen thus far is a BS and the genetics person.  If you read through the boards you will find this time frame is pretty normal.  We want it out NOW but we also want them to know everything before deciding what to do.  Hang in there.  I am hanging right with you.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, big pile of unknown Lifeonitsside debbie6122

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 01:47PM invisible2 wrote: Thanks to all for the advice.  I used to think I would remove my breast without a thought and then when faced with the possibility I have cold feet.  The biopsy schedule delays are due to my job travel schedule plus my surgeon is going to be out of town due to a death in her family.  She has offered to turn my case over to another surgeon but I am really comfortable with her.  She feels I am in no danger if we take some time to get to the answer.  I have large breasts (even after a reduction 30 years ago) so I keep thinking they could take a good size chunk and still leave me plenty.  Then I could have a reduction on the other side.   I usually make decisions like this with my gut...but my gut is not talking these days.  It's tied in a big old knot.  I am struggling to manage my anxiety.  Plus I am just plain mad.
Posts.Title: Help..need advice...just diagnosed invisible2 invisible2

Posts.Content: invisible2 wrote: I was recently diagosed (through core biopsy on 2/22/12) with Grade 2 IDC and DCIS ER/PR+. The original mass was estimated at approx 1.9 cm.  The surgeon ordered an MRI.  After the MRI the radiologist did more mammograms and another ultrasound.  When reviewing the results the radiologist told me she found two more areas: a small mass and an area of linear calcifications. She felt strongly that the results indicated a multifocal cancer (all in the same quadrant) but they couldn't be sure without two more biopsies.  She said they mark each area they biopsy with a clip and then use a mammogram to measure the distance between each clip.  That measurement will give them the information they need to decide if I am a candidate for a lumpectomy or a mastectomy.  I am totally freaking out.   It will be weeks of further tests and waiting to get the answer.   At first it seemed clear to me - forget the additional biopsies and have an immediate mastectomy.    Now I am having second thoughts. I am so scared of making the wrong decision. I am 60 years old.  I have a family history of BC.  My sister had premenopausal breast cancer and died at 46.  Thoughts?  Advice?   Dx 2/27/2012, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 5/17/2012 Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 5/17/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right Surgery 5/31/2012 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Hormonal Therapy 10/10/2012 Femara (letrozole) Surgery 12/3/2012 Reconstruction (right) Surgery 6/6/2013 Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap Surgery 9/3/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help..need advice...just diagnosed invisible2 invisible2

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2012 04:15AM invisible2 wrote: Phone call - plus an office visit later that afternoon.  I had the biopsy on Wednesday afternoon and the surgeon called me the following Monday morning. I am happy it was handled that way.  I had time to gather my thoughts (and my husband) and be able to talk with her in person later that day.
Posts.Title: How did you hear biopsy results--phone or appt? frazzledmom schoolmom
